intro: Sideroxylon gamblei, commonly known as the Gambles' ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
